tkwatch
Class WatchlistItem

java.lang.Object
  tkwatch.WatchlistItem

public class WatchlistItem
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates a watchlist item. This object comprises the fields implied by the Beta TradeKing API Documentation, 03.25.2011, p. 20, augmented by a notation field. The notation field is available for the user to store whatever he or she wants to say about why the item is being watched.

Needs to have XML handling functions added.

Contest version.

Constructor Detail

WatchlistItem

public WatchlistItem()
Default constructor

WatchlistItem

public WatchlistItem(double newCostBasis,
                     java.lang.String newInstrument,
                     java.lang.String newNotation,
                     double newQuantity)
Constructor with arguments.

Parameters:
newCostBasis - The new cost basis, used by TradeKing to "... assist in providing a portfolio value for the client."
newInstrument - The market symbol of the instrument the user wants to watch.
newNotation - The free text entered by the user to explain why this element is being watched.
newQuantity - The new quantity, used by TradeKing to "... assist in providing a portfolio value for the client."

public WatchlistItem(WatchlistItem oldWatchlistItem)
Copy constructor.

Parameters:
oldWatchlistItem - The watchlist item to copy.

public static final boolean delete(java.lang.String theInstrument)
Deletes a watchlist item from the database by instrument symbol.

Parameters:
theInstrument - The market symbol of the instrument.
Returns:

getAll

public static final java.util.ArrayList<WatchlistItem> getAll()
Returns all watchlist items in the database in an ArrayList, suitable for creating a TradeKing watchlist update request.

Returns:
Returns a ArrayList of watchlist items.

isStored

public static final boolean isStored(java.lang.String theInstrument)
Determines whether a watchlist item with a given instrument symbol is stored in the database.

Parameters:
theInstrument - The symbol of the instrument in question.
Returns:
Returns true if a watchlist item with the given instrument symbol exists in the database, false otherwise.

retrieve

public static final WatchlistItem retrieve(java.lang.String theInstrument)
Retrieves a watchlist item from the database by instrument symbol.

Parameters:
theInstrument - The market symbol of the instrument.
Returns:
Returns the desired watchlist item or null if it's not stored.

update

public static boolean update(WatchlistItem itemToUpdate)
Updates the entry with the selected instrument symbol in the database.

Parameters:
itemToUpdate - The symbol of the instrument to be updated.
Returns:
Returns true if the update succeeded, false otherwise.

delete

public final boolean delete()
Enables a watchlist item to delete itself from the database. If this method returns true, the caller is assured that no item with the same market symbol exists in the database.

Returns:
Returns true if the item is deleted or not stored in the first place, false if the delete fails.

store

public final boolean store()
Enables a watchlist item to store itself in the database, overwriting anything that may already be stored.

Returns:
Returns true if the entity successfully stores itself, false if the store fails.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Converts a watchlist to a string representation for display at the console.

This function currently emulates the output of an array toString(). It should eventually be converted to produce an XML output.
